newsitem.title: USA: US West unit debt deal may be increased.
newsitem.headline: US West unit debt deal may be increased.

text.p: US West Capital Funding's planned $2.0 billion four-part debt offering is rumored to have been increased with the addition of another tranche, high-grade syndicate sources said Tuesday.
US West Capital Funding is a unit of US West Inc.
"Talk in the market is that the issuer added an additional tranche consisting of a century bond to the offering," said one syndicate source.
The A2/BBB-plus rated deal is now rumord to come in between $2.25 and $3.0 billion, syndicate sources said.
They said current price talk on the issue is as follows:
- five-year, 55 to 60 basis points over Treasuries.
- 40-year, put seven, 55 to 60 basis points over Treasuries.
- 100-year bond is rumored to be added; the amount was not immediately available.
